title: "STAT 311 Reference Sheet Chapter 1"
output: html_document

<div>  
  <ul>
    <li>
      <h3 style="color: orange"> Help Function </h3>
      <h4>&emsp; Syntax </h4>
      <p> 
         &emsp;  &emsp;```??<object>```, where ```<object>```
        is the thing you want to learn more about. Type this in the <b>Console.</b>
      </p>
      <h4>&emsp; Usage</h4>
      <p>
        &emsp;&emsp; RStudio will open the <b>Viewer</b> window, displaying 
        information related to the <i>object</i> of interest.
      </p>
      <h4> &emsp; Output </h4>
      <p>
        &emsp; &emsp; A <b>Viewer</b> with information.
    </li>
    
    <li>
      <h3 style="color: orange"> Glimpse Function </h3>
      <h4> &emsp; Syntax </h4>
      <p>
        &emsp;  &emsp; ```glimpse( <object> )```
      </p>
      
      <h4>  &emsp; Usage </h4>
      <p>
        &emsp; &emsp; RStudio will output a short excerpt of data. <br>
        &emsp; &emsp; This data will contain row, and column information, along            with a few valid rows.
      </p>
      <h4> &emsp; Output </h4>
      <p>
        &emsp; &emsp; A tibble of data; by default into the console<br>
      </p>
    </li>
    
    
  </ul>


</div>

<div>
  <h1> Other Help</h1>
  <h3>&emsp; How do I create a new subfolder in RStudio? </h3>
  <h4> &emsp; &emsp; Press the "New Folder" Icon.
  ```{r echo=FALSE}
    knitr::include_graphics("../Images/Chapter1Folder.png")
  ```
  </h4>
  
  <h3> &emsp; How do I copy to a directory? </h3>
  <h4> &emsp; &emsp; A directory, or subfolder, can be created using the above method.
  When copying, press the square select icon next to the file, then press the <b>More</b>
  ```{r echo=FALSE}
  knitr::include_graphics("../Images/Chapter1More.png")
  ```
  Icon, and select <b>Copy To</b>, then navigate to the desired directory.
</div>
